Module com.example.appointmentmanager
Package com.example.controller

Class AppointmentsOverviewController

java.lang.Object
com.example.controller.AppointmentsOverviewController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AppointmentsOverviewController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controller for Main GUI - Handles all button clicks to perform tasks and serves as the application home page

    • deleteCustomer

      public void deleteCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Delete existing customer Ensures that there is a customer selected on the table. Then sends verification pops to user to verify they want to delete the customer. If confirmed, sends to the customer form handler to delete with DB. Verifies successful deletion with another pop on conpletion.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent -

    • modifyCustomer

      public void modifyCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Modify Exisiting Customer Action Event Listens for button click on "Modify Customer" and then triggers the customerForm controller to handle the processing. Passes the selected customer to the customerForm controller to pre-populate customer data in the fields. Sets the new scene and pops open the window and waits on the form submission or cancellation.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent -
      Throws:
      IOException

    • reports

      public void reports(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Report Button Action handler Listens for click on the report button. When clicked, the stage and scene change to the report page. The reporting page stays open waiting on the close button to be clicked and then is returned to the main stage and scene.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent -

    • logout

      Parameters:
      actionEvent -

    • appointmentTableView

      public void appointmentTableView(String viewType)
      Populates The Appointment Table with data from DB. This method holds the data and table assignment for the appointment table. It takes a String param of viewType to determine what "filter" to apply to the appointment observable list. To properly display the appointments, whichever toggle button is clicked.
      Parameters:
      viewType - as String, hard coded values to the toggle group

    • aptCalFilter

      public void aptCalFilter(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Toggle Group Calendar Filter For Appointment Table. This method listens for action events ON the toggle group. When an action even is heard on the group, the method checks to see which target the action event was on and then calls the appointmentTableView method with the target hard coded keyword.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - listens for click on the toggle group

    • changeTableView

      public void changeTableView(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Action Event listener to change from Appointment Table to Customer Table. Listens for an action event on the @changeTableView button. The application is initialized with the appointments table showing. There is a button that says "View Customers", when this is clicked the table changes to the customer table by toggling the visibility of the two tables with an if statement. This also toggles the button text value between "View customers" and "View Appointments".
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - listens for action on @changeTableView button

    • customerTableView

      public void customerTableView()
      Initializes Customer Table. Maps the column values of the customer table to the observable list recieved from the method call to Customer.getAllCustomers().

    • upcomingAppointmentAlert

      public void upcomingAppointmentAlert()
      Upcoming Appointment Alert (15 Minutes). This method is called from the mainLogin controller upon a successful login. This sets up a new alert, and gets a copy of the observable list from Appointment.getAllAppointments(). It then goes through each appointment and checks the start date to the user local date. If there is a match, it then checks to see if the start appointment is within 15 minutes of the users local time at login. If there is a matching appointment, the GUI pops an alert right before scenes are changed alerting the user of the Appointment ID and time. If not appointment matches, an alert is popped displaying "No appointments within 15 minutes".

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      JavaFX Initialize Appointment Overview Scene Sets the local time zone to the current users timezone. Calls the upcomingAppointmentAlert to ensure alerts are displayed upon successful login. Then calls both table views (customer, appointment) to ensure the data is retrieved and ready for display.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
